articles.headline: Johnson Outlines Plan for Ukraine Aid; House Could Act Within Weeks
articles.snippet: The G.O.P. speaker’s proposed conditions for sending a fresh infusion of military assistance to Kyiv are the strongest sign to date that he plans to defy critics in his own party and push through the aid package.
articles.abstract: The G.O.P. speaker’s proposed conditions for sending a fresh infusion of military assistance to Kyiv are the strongest sign to date that he plans to defy critics in his own party and push through the aid package.
articles.lead_paragraph: Speaker Mike Johnson has begun publicly laying out potential conditions for extending a fresh round of American military assistance to Ukraine, the strongest indication yet that he plans to push through the House a package that many Republicans view as toxic and have tried to block.

articles.headline: Florida Court Allows 6-Week Abortion Ban, but Voters Will Get to Weigh In
articles.snippet: The Florida Supreme Court found that the State Constitution’s privacy protections do not extend to abortion. But it also allowed a ballot question on whether to expand abortion access.
articles.abstract: The Florida Supreme Court found that the State Constitution’s privacy protections do not extend to abortion. But it also allowed a ballot question on whether to expand abortion access.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Florida Supreme Court overturned decades of legal precedent on Monday in ruling that the State Constitution’s privacy protections do not extend to abortion, effectively allowing Florida to ban the procedure after six weeks of pregnancy.

articles.headline: 3 Top Iranian Commanders Are Reported Killed in Israeli Strike in Syria
articles.snippet: The airstrike on an Iranian Embassy building was one of the biggest attacks yet in a shadow war that has increasingly been moving into the open.
articles.abstract: The airstrike on an Iranian Embassy building was one of the biggest attacks yet in a shadow war that has increasingly been moving into the open.
articles.lead_paragraph: At least three senior commanders and four officers overseeing Iran’s covert operations in the Middle East were killed on Monday when Israeli warplanes struck a building in Damascus that is part of the Iranian Embassy complex, according to Iranian and Syrian officials.
articles.byline: By Farnaz Fassihi, Ronen Bergman, Aaron Boxerman, Hiba Yazbek and Michael Levenson

articles.headline: Poor Nations Are Writing a New Handbook for Getting Rich
articles.snippet: Economies focused on exports have lifted millions out of poverty, but epochal changes in trade, supply chains and technology are making it a lot harder.
articles.abstract: Economies focused on exports have lifted millions out of poverty, but epochal changes in trade, supply chains and technology are making it a lot harder.
articles.lead_paragraph: For more than half a century, the handbook for how developing countries can grow rich hasn’t changed much: Move subsistence farmers into manufacturing jobs, and then sell what they produce to the rest of the world.

articles.headline: Israeli Army Withdraws From Major Gaza Hospital, Leaving Behind a Wasteland
articles.snippet: Al-Shifa Hospital lies in ruins after a battle there between Israeli soldiers and Gazan gunmen. Shortly before withdrawing, the Israeli military brought journalists from The Times to witness the damage.
articles.abstract: Al-Shifa Hospital lies in ruins after a battle there between Israeli soldiers and Gazan gunmen. Shortly before withdrawing, the Israeli military brought journalists from The Times to witness the damage.
articles.lead_paragraph: Al-Shifa Hospital in Gaza City, once the fulcrum of Gaza’s health system and now an emblem of its destruction, stood in ruins on Sunday, as if a tsunami had surged through it followed by a tornado.
articles.byline: By Patrick Kingsley and Avishag Shaar-Yashuv

articles.headline: 5-Star Bird Houses for Picky but Precious Guests: Nesting Swiftlets
articles.snippet: To lure swiftlets, whose saliva-built nests fetch high prices in China, people in Borneo compete to build them the most luxurious accommodations: safe, clean, dark and with pools for bathing.
articles.abstract: To lure swiftlets, whose saliva-built nests fetch high prices in China, people in Borneo compete to build them the most luxurious accommodations: safe, clean, dark and with pools for bathing.
articles.lead_paragraph: With no windows, the gloomy, gray building looming four stories above the rice fields in a remote village in Indonesian Borneo resembles nothing more than a prison.
articles.byline: By Richard C. Paddock, Muktita Suhartono and Nyimas Laula

articles.headline: Tesla’s Sales Drop, a Sign That Its Grip on the E.V. Market Is Slipping
articles.snippet: Sales of the company’s electric cars dropped in the first three months of the year, even as other automakers sold more battery-powered vehicles.
articles.abstract: Sales of the company’s electric cars dropped in the first three months of the year, even as other automakers sold more battery-powered vehicles.
articles.lead_paragraph: Tesla appeared to be losing command of the market it effectively created after it reported a stunning drop in quarterly sales on Tuesday, raising fresh questions about Elon Musk’s leadership of the company.
articles.byline: By Jack Ewing and Neal E. Boudette

articles.headline: An A.I. Researcher Takes On Election Deepfakes
articles.snippet: Oren Etzioni was once an optimist about artificial intelligence. Now, his nonprofit, TrueMedia.org, is offering tools for fighting A.I.-manipulated content.
articles.abstract: Oren Etzioni was once an optimist about artificial intelligence. Now, his nonprofit, TrueMedia.org, is offering tools for fighting A.I.-manipulated content.
articles.lead_paragraph: For nearly 30 years, Oren Etzioni was among the most optimistic of artificial intelligence researchers.
articles.byline: By Cade Metz and Tiffany Hsu
